alert.note: Alert for Caswell (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 20 at 5:44AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Flood Advisory Now In Effect for much of Caswell and Pittsylvania Counties, as well as the City of Danville... ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by heavy rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central North Carolina and south central Virginia, including the following counties and independent city, in north central North Carolina, Caswell. In south central Virginia, City of Danville and Pittsylvania. * WHEN...Until 845 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 543 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to showers and thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Banister River, Country Line Creek, Burkes Creek, Birch Creek, Cane Creek, Childress Creek, Cherrystone Creek and Benton Branch. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Danville... Yanceyville... Bethel... Providence... Blairs... Jericho... Prospect Hill... - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
